caption_original: Do you turn your thermostat down in your house on cold nights to save energy? Chickadees do that too! They allow their body temperature, normally above 38o C, to drop down as low as 28oC. They also grow more down in the fall to get ready for winter.

caption_original: Don't you just love balloons? We do too, especially weather balloons! These special balloons are launched twice a day at the same time all around the world to collect data. That data is then used to produce charts of the atmosphere called “upper air analysis.” http://ow.ly/YqrYv

caption_original: A healthy lake requires nutrients. However, when nutrient levels become too high they lead to excess algae growth that can degrade water quality and harm ecosystem health. In Lake Erie, one of the five Great Lakes, too much of the nutrient phosphorus has caused large scale algae blooms.  We have adopted targets to reduce the amount of phosphorus entering Lake Erie.  From farmers to home owners, everyone can practice phosphorus reduction activities! http://ow.ly/YCC1W http://ow.ly/YCy0u
caption_cleaned: A healthy lake requires nutrients. However, when nutrient levels become too high they lead to excess algae growth that can degrade water quality and harm ecosystem health. In Lake Erie, one of the five Great Lakes, too much of the nutrient phosphorus has caused large scale algae blooms. We have adopted targets to reduce the amount of phosphorus entering Lake Erie. From farmers to home owners, everyone can practice phosphorus reduction activities! 0u

caption_original: Mariners and fishers! Ever heard of Weatheradio? caption_original:
If you are a fisher, farmer or even an outdoors enthusiast, wetlands play a major role in your life. Wetlands support Canadians economically, socially and environmentally. Further, marshes, swamps, bogs, fens and shallow waters host a huge variety of life, protect our coastlines, act as natural sponges against flooding, and store carbon that helps regulate climate change. Let’s celebrate the importance of wetlands together. Happy World Wetlands Day! 

The Government of Canada is working with partner funding programs such as the National Wetland Conservation Fund to support projects that restore and enhance wetlands. http://ow.ly/XOGBY http://ow.ly/XOGFJ
caption_cleaned: If you are a fisher, farmer or even an outdoors enthusiast, wetlands play a major role in your life. Wetlands support Canadians economically, socially and environmentally. Further, marshes, swamps, bogs, fens and shallow waters host a huge variety of life, protect our coastlines, act as natural sponges against flooding, and store carbon that helps regulate climate change. Let’s celebrate the importance of wetlands together. Happy World Wetlands Day! The Government of Canada is working with partner funding programs such as the National Wetland Conservation Fund to support projects that restore and enhance wetlands.
